channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Senate hearing with Trump budget chief highlights potential changes to $9.4 billion cuts package
item.description: Senate Republicans on Wednesday forced the White House budget chief to defend parts of a $9.4 billion package of Trump-requested spending cuts, signal...

item.title: Protest Is Overrated
item.description: For most protests in modern America, the operating assumption is that action from the government will solve the problem.

item.title: WATCH: Republicans share views on gay marriage decade after Supreme Court decision
item.description: Ten years after the Supreme Court legalized gay marriage, GOP representatives share traditional marriage beliefs while accepting the ruling as the law...

item.title: New York Republicans warn of 'disaster' if 'dangerous' Zohran Mamdani wins mayoral race
item.description: Republicans in New York's congressional delegation are heckling presumptive Democratic mayoral nominee Zohran Mamdani.

item.title: Leftist L.A.-Area Vice Mayor Allegedly Calls On Gangs To Fight ICE
item.description: Calls were reportedly growing for Gonzalez to resign after she allegedly called on gangs to defend their turf against ICE.

item.title: Fortune 500 companies that have active contracts with ICE
item.description: From AT&T to FedEx, these are the organizations contracting with the Immigration and Customs Enforcement.

item.title: If Trump Doesn’t Reject Judicial Supremacism, His Presidency Is Finished
item.description: Just because the judiciary chooses to violate the Constitution does not mean the other branches are required to follow suit.

item.title: One Step the U.S. Must Take to Restore the Navy
item.description: Shipyards exist to build ships, but without orders, nothing happens. It’s time for Congress to change that.

item.title: Meet Shubhanshu Shukla, Tibor Kapu, and Slawosz Uznanski-Wisniewski, the first astronauts from India, Hungary, and Poland to visit the International Space Station
item.description: Axiom Space, based in Houston, arranged the chartered flight, which was commanded by America’s most experienced astronaut, Peggy Whitson.

item.title: Trump Administration Deports Another Alien to El Salvador in Violation of Court Order
item.description: It appears that the administration should be able to deport Jordin Melgar-Salmeron, but it’s shooting itself in the foot.

item.title: RFK Jr. and his new vaccine committee are obsessing over thimerosal, a preservative antivaxxers have falsely tied to autism despite zero evidence of causation
item.description: Some public health experts contend the thimerosal discussion will unnecessarily raise doubt in vaccines.

item.title: Supreme Court boots challenge to state defunding Planned Parenthood in major pro-life victory
item.description: The Supreme Court ruled on whether South Carolina violated Medicaid patients' right to choose health care providers by blocking Planned Parenthood mon...

item.title: Islamist Winning NYC Mayor Primary 25 Years After Sept. 11 Shows Even Legal Immigration Is A Huge Problem
item.description: For Democrats, the most American thing you can do is destroy America, and anything done to preserve tradition is un-American.

item.title: Pennsylvania House passes bill mandating cursive education in schools
item.description: An analog throwback in a digital world.

item.title: Rewarding carbon-conscious consumers isn’t radical—it’s the future of banking
item.description: Smart banks will earn Gen Z loyalty by incorporating ESG signals into how customers are scored, segmented, and rewarded.

item.title: Taxpayer-Funded Libraries Promote These Graphic Books To Kids For Pride Month
item.description: While librarians and their supporters consistently decry critiques of their LGBT advocacy as censorship, less attention has been paid to the actual co...

item.title: The Cost of ‘Common Sense’
item.description: Regulation should rest on evidence, not intuition.

item.title: White House demands apology from Miami Herald for ‘false reporting’ on migrant children deportations
item.description: Members of the Trump administration are hitting back hard against “false reporting" from the Miami Herald claiming that the administration targeted mi...

item.title: DC House delegate's office walks back 88-year-old's statement that she'll run for re-election
item.description: Del. Eleanor Holmes Norton said that she is going to run for re-election, but her office has indicated that a decision has not yet been made.

item.title: Art About Love of Country Rules the Headlines
item.description: At least at NR it does: A reborn triumphal arch in Brooklyn, America 250 in Venice, bias at the Smithsonian, and a sublime Canaletto on the auction bl...

item.title: New York Chooses Its Fate
item.description: Lurking behind Mamdani’s pie-in-the-sky socialist agenda is his abiding commitment to anti-Zionism. None of this bodes well for NYC.

item.title: Trump lashes out at media over scrutiny of Iran bombings' success following intel reports
item.description: President Trump continues to defend the success of the U.S. attack on three of Iran's key nuclear sites, criticizing news reports that say otherwise.
